episodes.title: Bart Gets an F
episodes.plot: Mrs. Krabappel, fed up with Bart's lackadaisical approach to his studies, gives him an ultimatum: shape up or repeat the fourth grade.

episodes.title: Simpson and Delilah
episodes.plot: Homer lies on a medical insurance form in order to obtain a miracle hair restoring drug.

episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror
episodes.plot: The Simpsons move into a cursed house, then are abducted by aliens, before Homer is ensconced in a tale by Edgar Allen Poe.

episodes.title: Two Cars in Every Garage and Three Eyes on Every Fish
episodes.plot: After the power plant experiences bad publicity and is threatened with closure, Mr. Burns decides to run for Governor in order to have power over the law.

episodes.title: Dancin' Homer
episodes.plot: Homer's heckling of the Springfield Isotopes baseball team during one of their games inadvertently leads to his appointment as the new team mascot.

episodes.title: Dead Putting Society
episodes.plot: In an attempt to show up Ned Flanders, Homer pits Bart against Ned's son, Todd, in a miniature golf competition.

episodes.title: Bart vs. Thanksgiving
episodes.plot: On Thanksgiving, Bart runs away after fighting with Lisa.

episodes.title: Bart the Daredevil
episodes.plot: After seeing a motorcycle daredevil at a monster truck show, Bart becomes a death-defying daredevil skateboarder.

episodes.title: Itchy & Scratchy & Marge
episodes.plot: Marge becomes a crusader against cartoon violence after "Itchy and Scratchy" seemingly inspires Maggie to attack Homer.

episodes.title: Bart Gets Hit by a Car
episodes.plot: While skateboarding down the street, Bart is hit by a car driven by Mr. Burns. Homer turns down Mr. Burns' token offer of $100, and instead hires ambulance-chaser Lionel Hutz to bring an outrageous lawsuit against the millionaire.

episodes.title: One Fish, Two Fish, Blowfish, Blue Fish
episodes.plot: After apparently consuming poison blowfish, Homer is told that he only has 24 hours to live.

episodes.title: The Way We Was
episodes.plot: Homer and Marge tell the story of how they met and fell in love in high school.

episodes.title: Homer vs. Lisa and the 8th Commandment
episodes.plot: Homer gets a crooked cable guy to install free cable in the Simpson home, and as a result, Lisa faces an ethical crisis over her family's stealing.

episodes.title: Principal Charming
episodes.plot: Homer tries to set Selma up with Principal Skinner, only for him to fall for Patty instead.

episodes.title: Oh Brother, Where Art Thou?
episodes.plot: After Grampa is hospitalized, he reveals that Homer has a half-brother, and the family set out to find him.

episodes.title: Bart's Dog Gets an F
episodes.plot: After an uncontrollable Santa's Little Helper destroys several important Simpson possessions, Homer announces that he will be thrown out of the house unless he completes obedience training.

episodes.title: Old Money
episodes.plot: After Grampa's new girlfriend dies and leaves him $106,000 in her will, he tries to decide what to do with it.

episodes.title: Brush with Greatness
episodes.plot: After rekindling her artistic talents, Marge is commissioned to paint a portrait of Mr. Burns; Homer vows to lose weight after getting trapped in a water slide.

episodes.title: Lisa's Substitute
episodes.plot: Lisa has a crush on her substitute teacher; Bart decides to run for class president.

episodes.title: The War of the Simpsons
episodes.plot: Homer must decide whether he should complete marriage counseling or skip out to catch a legendary catfish; Bart and Lisa take advantage of Grampa's ignorance of the house rules.

episodes.title: Three Men and a Comic Book
episodes.plot: Bart, Milhouse and Martin each pitch in to buy an expensive comic book, which soon has a disastrous effect on their friendship.

episodes.title: Blood Feud
episodes.plot: After Bart saves Mr. Burns' life with a blood transfusion, Homer vows revenge when they receive only a "thank you" card as compensation.
